meanings.definition: A nocturnal bird with a wide froglike mouth.
meanings.sent1: The frogmouth silently swooped down to catch its prey in the dark of night.
meanings.sent2: I saw a frogmouth perched on a tree branch while hiking in the forest.
meanings.sent3: Why did the frogmouth bring a flashlight to the party? To light up the night with its wide mouth!
meanings.sent4: The frogmouth's mouth was as wide as a canyon, ready to swallow up any unsuspecting insects.
meanings.sent5: In the shadows, the frogmouth's froglike mouth seemed to blend seamlessly with the night.

meanings.definition: A type of bird native to Australia and Southeast Asia.
meanings.sent1: The colorful plumage of the frogmouth stood out among the trees in the Australian wilderness.
meanings.sent2: Have you ever seen a frogmouth up close? They are fascinating birds!
meanings.sent3: The frogmouth and the kangaroo decided to have a friendly hopping competition in the outback.
meanings.sent4: The frogmouth soared through the sky like a feathered ambassador of the Australian bush.
meanings.sent5: The frogmouth's call echoed through the rainforest, a reminder of the wild beauty of Australia.
